page.title: 17Coton Manor Gardens
page.content: Coton Manor is surrounded by a charming old English Garden,beautifully laid out and enhanced by a collection of water- fowl.The house is of 17th century stone dating back to 1662.It was built on the site of a previous Manor House which was razed to the ground after the Battle of Naseby by Cromwell supporters the owners work hard to maintain the gardens - a series of little waterfalls and gently flowing streams are surround -ed by lovely plants and walkways.There are flamingoes, cranes and ducks amongst the exotic waterfowl which roam freely.It is on a gently sloping site with an abundance of spring water drain -ing down to the reservoir.The Gardens are open on selected days to the public who can enjoy its peace and charm.There is a gift shop,tea room and plants for sale.To greet you at the gate along with Cmdr.Pasley-Tyler is a parrot,Emma
